text.section: There is a Board of Boiler Rules in the Division of Labor and Industry in the Department of Labor, Licensing, and Regulation.

section.section:
The Board consists of the following 10 members:
as an ex officio member, the Commissioner; and
nine members appointed by the Governor with the advice of the Secretary and with the advice and consent of the Senate.

While a member of the Board, the consumer member may not:
have a financial interest in or receive compensation from a person regulated by the Board; or
grade any examination given by or for the Board.
The term of an appointed member is 4 years.
The terms of the appointed members are staggered as required by the terms provided for members of the Board on October 1, 2003.
At the end of a term, a member continues to serve until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
A member who is appointed after a term has begun serves only for the rest of the term and until a successor is appointed and qualifies.

text.section: The Board shall elect a chairman from among its members.

section.section: The Commissioner may not receive additional compensation as a member of the Board.

An appointed member of the Board:
may not receive a salary as a member of the Board; but
is entitled to:
compensation in accordance with the State budget; and
reimbursement for expenses under the Standard State Travel Regulations, as provided in the State budget.

text.section: The exercise or performance of the powers, authority, duties, and functions of the Board under this subtitle is subject to the power and authority of the Secretary.
